'''Morwë''' and '''Nurwë''' were the leaders of two of the kindreds of the [[Avari]],<ref>{{AA|57|note}}, p. 88</ref> according to a version of the [[legendarium]] that [[Christopher Tolkien]] considered abandoned by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|his father]].<ref>{{WJ|Editor}}, Note 12, p. 418</ref>

== History ==
The [[Elves]] of the kindreds of Morwë and Nurwë dwelt furthest away from the waters of [[Cuiviénen]]. They wandered among the hills and never saw [[Oromë]] when he first came to them.

During the first [[sundering of the Elves]], the kindreds of Morwë and Nurwë had refused the summons of Oromë, as they preferred the starlight over the rumor of the [[Two Trees of Valinor|Two Trees]] in [[Aman]]. Moreover, they feared the [[Valar]], especially Oromë and his steed [[Nahar]], considering Oromë a [[Demons|demon]] "that would devour them" - possibly because of the lies of [[Melkor]].<ref name=Avar>{{AA|57}}, pp. 81-2</ref>

They remained at Cuiviénen with half of the [[Tatyar]] (the second clan, whose other half later became known as the ''[[Noldor]]''), and a third of the [[Nelyar]] (the third clan, whose other two thirds later became known as the ''[[Teleri]]'' or ''[[Lindar]]'').<ref>{{WJ|C}}, pp. 380-1</ref><ref group=note>In another text, found in ''[[The Nature of Middle-earth]]'', '''all''' of the original 144 [[Awakening of the Elves|unbegotten]] Elves refused the summons of the [[Valar]] and stayed at Cuiviénen, including all 14 unbegotten [[Minyar]].</ref>

== Etymology ==
The names ''Morwë'' and ''Nurwë'' are in [[Quenya]], but they are not glossed.

''Morwë'' might have been composed of the root [[MOR]]- ("black, dark, darkness") + the suffix ''[[-wë]]'', a common (if not always masculine) element in ancient [[Elvish]] names.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2994304937.html|articlename=Q. ''Morwë'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=06 August 2023}}</ref>

''Nurwë'', likewise, contains the suffix ''-wë'', but the first element of his name is unclear.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3505907111.html|articlename=Q. ''Nurwë'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=28 March 2024}}</ref>
